trivia_items.text: His codename is the Cantonese/Jyutping romanization of ā (pronounced as "ah"). The Hanzi, when combined with Hung's, makes up 阿吽, which is the Chinese pronunciation for Om.
According to his illustrator KuroBlood, Aak has the traits of a shishi. One can be seen in his Elite 2 artwork.
sub_items: In contrast to Hung's, the spirit animal in said artwork resembles the a-gyō, the more lion or cat-like of the two komainu, which is tasked with keeping evil out and thus has its mouth open as to utter "ah."
The komainu are in fact Japanese version of the Chinese shishi, hence the similarities.

trivia_items.text: Because his Stimpack skills is the only method of inflicting "friendly fire" in Arknights as well as his "evil" appearance and his occupation as an underground doctor, Aak has become a subject of many memes within the Arknights community. These include:
sub_items: "Team Quacksalver" which often pairs him together with Warfarin (whose Unstable Plasma can damage friendly units).

Being seen as a traitor by Rhodes Island, notably one based on Shepherd's treachery in Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 and Among Us.
This trait is immortalized by one video of him using his Stimpack skills on Suzuran in TW-4 to place Ifrit or Weedy there instead.

trivia_items.text: Aak was the Operator who stayed as the sole member of his archetype, the Geek Specialist, the longest, until the release of Spuria in June 2023.
